meanings.definition: A unit of illumination equal to one lumen per square meter.
meanings.sent1: The room was well-lit with a lux of 500.
meanings.sent2: The lux level in the photography studio was perfect for capturing clear images.
meanings.sent3: The lux decided to take a break and dim down the lights for a cozy atmosphere.
meanings.sent4: Her smile added a lux to the room, brightening everyone's mood.
meanings.sent5: The lux of the sunrise painted the sky in vibrant colors.

meanings.definition: A measure of the intensity of light.
meanings.sent1: The lux reading showed how bright the spotlight was.
meanings.sent2: The lux of the flashlight was not strong enough to illuminate the entire room.
meanings.sent3: The lux level on the light meter made the photographer realize they needed more lighting.
meanings.sent4: The lux of the sun at noon was almost blinding.
meanings.sent5: The lux of the streetlamp barely reached the dark alleyway.
